definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Then when you get older and think back, you’ll be able to enjoy it a second time.
sentences.chinese: 當你年老回首往事時，便能再次享受你的一生。

sentences.english: Over the years Lottie had urged Bess to prepare for her old age.
sentences.chinese: 年年歲歲珞蒂總勸碧絲要爲年老之後做點準備。

sentences.english: The old king reposed too little power in the young chancellor.
sentences.chinese: 年老的國王授予這位年輕宰相的權力太小了。

sentences.english: Aerobic exercise keeps your muscles strong, which can help you maintain mobility as you get older.
sentences.chinese: 有氧運動鍛鍊了肌肉，當你年老時仍能靈活自如。

sentences.english: Old as he was, he was not ashamed to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他雖然年老，卻不恥於學習。

sentences.english: I have been young, and now am old;
sentences.chinese: 我從前年幼，現在年老，卻未見過義人被棄。

sentences.english: The old king returned to power after ten years' banishment.
sentences.chinese: 這位年老的國王在流放了十年以後又重掌政權。

sentences.english: Having spent his youth inidleness, he is having to work in his old age.
sentences.chinese: 他年輕時不務正業，年老時非辛苦工作不可。

sentences.english: Enema for constipation in children and the treatment of the elderly and infirm.
sentences.chinese: 開塞露用於小兒及年老體弱者便祕的治療。

sentences.english: Ginger President to come to the end, refuse to the loss of wild dont teach disciples.
sentences.chinese: 姜會長以年老體衰，教不了徒弟爲由拒絕了失野。

sentences.english: This old pine has undergone extreme weather but still stands tall and straight.
sentences.chinese: 這棵百年老松歷經了百年風雨依然樹身勁拔。

sentences.english: Help the old and the weak when go upstairs or downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 當上下樓梯時，幫助年老體弱者。

sentences.english: The earth is never too old to celebrate spring.
sentences.chinese: 大地慶祝春天從不年老色衰。

sentences.english: You must be careful not to ignore the needs of the youngsters in your family.
sentences.chinese: 肯定不要怠忽家中年老的需求。

sentences.english: And when they got old, they wanted to be able to retire with some dignity and respect.
sentences.chinese: 當年老體衰，他們能帶着尊嚴和尊敬退休生活。

sentences.english: He doesn't work as quickly as he used to because of his old age.
sentences.chinese: 由於年老體弱，他不像原來工作得那樣快了。

definition: one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
lit. robust years/prime of life/summer/able-bodied (fit for military service)/mature (talent, garden etc)
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
